contentrichtext.text: {{for|the early modern Gallican writer|Jacques Gillot (jurist)}} {{Expand French|topic=gov|date=December 2008|Jacques Gillot}} '''Jacques Gillot''', b. 4 March 1948 in Gosier, on the [[France|French]] [[Caribbean]] island of [[Guadeloupe]], is the {{As of|2004|alt=current}} [[President of the General Council]] of Guadeloupe.<ref>{{cite news|title=Guadeloupe: le LKP a signé le protocole de suspension du conflit|url=http://www.challenges.fr/depeches/politique_economique/20090305.FAP5731/guadeloupe_le_lkp_a_signe_le_protocole_de_suspension_du.html|accessdate=7 February 2011|newspaper=[[:fr:Challenges{{!}}Challenges]]|date=5 March 2009|agency=Associated Press|language=French}}</ref> He has been chairing the General Council since March 2001. Gillot was elected to the [[French senate]] in 2004.<ref>[http://www.senat.fr/senateur/gillot_jacques04095r.html Gillot's Senate website]</ref> In addition, he is also the founding member of the ''[[United Guadeloupe, Socialism and Realities|Guadeloupe Unie Socialisme and Réalités]]'' ("United Guadeloupe Socialism and Realities") [[political party]]. Gillot is a [[physician]], is married and has three children. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Senators of France}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Gillot, Jacques | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Guadeloupean politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1948 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gillot, Jacques}} [[Category:1948 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Guadeloupean socialists]] [[Category:French people of Guadeloupean descent]] [[Category:French Senators of the Fifth Republic]] [[Category:Guadeloupean physicians]] [[Category:Guadeloupean politicians]] [[Category:United Guadeloupe, Socialism and Realities politicians]] {{Guadeloupe-politician-stub}}
